I purchased a couple of foam mice / Piston to use for putting a pull string through counduit. Store looks clean and organized. Located in the Pell City industrial park,

text: One of the best warehouses we have delivered to.  We knew we were going to be late for the appointment so I called and talked to Misty. She was very kind and friendly and told us to try to not be later than certain time. Finally the driver got there and they unloaded him really fast. . Thank you for your great staff, and friendly response.

resp.text: Thank you for your awesome review and for letting us know about our Misty! She's an absolute gem!

Huge cross dock service in this area.

resp.text: Thanks Joe!! We appreciate the awesome review! We will totally give Shawn some coffee! ha!

name: Tony Fichter
text: Our company is located 1500 miles from our customer in Anniston, Alabama.  We depend on Misty, Will, Cristi and the rest of the good people of BR Williams to receive, stock, pick and deliver our product accurately and timely.  They are all a joy to work with and the level of service they provide is second to none.  I highly recommend BR Williams for your logistics needs.

resp.text: Tony, what great words about our great people!! We appreciate this review!!!

name: Christine LaMar
text: Great company to work with! They always respond quickly to any questions we may have, and always willing to go the extra mile to provide us with the best service possible. One of the best public warehouses we work with!

resp.text: 5 Stars...THANK YOU!!! Christine, we appreciate you taking the time to give us this awesome review!

name: Jon Douglas
text: The service and support that our company gets from BR Williams is vital to our day to day business operations.  Without this service it would be very difficult to maintain the level of support we do with our customers along with the on time deliveries we provide.  BR Williams has truly been a blessing to our company and is integral in the growth we have experienced over the past several years.

resp.text: Thank you so much Jon!!! We love the awesome words!

name: Chuck Brock
text: Very dissatisfied, with the restrictions is hard to do any shopping, they have a small waiting area where service technicians conjugate while they stay behind a barrier

resp.text: Dear Chuck, due to an abundance of caution surrounding the spread of COVID-19, some locations are currently practicing Curbside Service only. We certainly hope things get back to normal soon. In the meantime, we do have some additional ordering / pickup tools available at www.bakerdist.com/covid-19. Thank you for your patience and we truly value your business.

name: Victor Garcia
text: Says it closes at 5 and they close by 4:30

resp.text: Dear Victor, thank you for bringing this to our attention. We had an incorrect closing time on Google; this has now been corrected. We sincerely apologize for this inconvenience and hope that you give us another chance in the future.

name: Chuck Brock
text: Great counter service!

resp.text: Dear Chuck, thank you for taking the time to leave us this excellent review. We are happy to hear that our counter service is meeting your expectations. Thank you for your business and we look forward to seeing you again soon.

name: Mike Hayes

resp.text: Dear Mike, thank you for taking the time to leave us this excellent review. We will be sure to pass along the kind words to our Mobile team. Thank you for your business and we look forward to seeing you again soon.

name: Randy Brown
text: We have been doing business with M&A for many years now and they provide outstanding service in all areas. The sales staff, delivery drivers, counter personnel and their tech people all are ready to help you with whatever your HVAC needs are. Our Regional Sales Manager Tim Belcher has gone above and beyond to work with us to establish a working partnership between our companies. I don't think you can go wrong dealing with M&A Supply, really good people to deal with.

resp.text: Thank you Randy!

text: M&A Supply is a great partner.  They provide continuous support and seek out resources to help their dealers create success.  They really get it!

A another satisfied customer and lots of thanks to Tim Belcher Regional Sales Manager for all he does to keep us updated.

text: WE ARE HAPPY TO HAVE M&A AS A VENDOR I HAVE USED THE COMPANY FOR YEARS THE TEAM IS HELPFUL, NICE, AND HAS A GOOD AMOUNT OF STOCK AVAILABLE WE VALUE M&A AS OUR YORK CONTACT POINT FOR THE PRODUCT LINE. WE HAVE NOTICED THAT COMMERCIAL QUOTES OUR DONE IN HOUSE AT THE MOBILE LOCATION WHICH HAS BEEN A ADDED VALUE, WE ARE LOOKING FORWARD TO MANY MORE YEARS OF BUSINESS TOGETHER.WHEN WE NEED YORK RELATED PRODUCTS WE WILL BE CALLING. THX !

resp.text: Thank you Kevin!

name: Matthew Goodwin
text: M&A

name: Lisa McCollum
text: I recently stopped in this shop as part of a search for a new sewing machine.  This shop is a Pfaff dealer, and I talked at length with the woman and her husband who own the shop about the machines they carry.  They were very friendly and took the time to show me the capabilities of each one and answered all my questions.  I didn't end up buying one of their machines; I bought a cheap Singer to hold me over for a year or two until I decide on the best higher end machine for me - but I really appreciated the treatment I got at Creative Sewing.  I will make a point to buy fabric and notions from them when possible.

name: F Little
text: The owners, Linda and Bob Christian, are extremely helpful.  They know EVERYTHING about Pfaff machines, including my 1970's era machine.  They have also given me super helpful instructions on hooping and machine embroidering.  I take my machine and questions to them whenever I can even though I live east of Atlanta, GA.

name: do it lik-at something lik-at
text: Good place to buy oil

name: Jason Latham
text: Out of the way

name: Richard Jackson
text: Great People, but it's a tight little back into the dock. Pull as far as you can against sidewalk into oncoming lane to stop and open doors and wait for an opening to cut out and block the whole road to get backed in. Go slow and be careful, 4wheelers don't wait for you to get backed in; they just whizz right around you and it would be easy to swing the front around and catch somebody as they're trying to squeak by. Other than the hassle of getting into and out of there, everything is great about the place.

name: Dana Maxwell
text: Gorgeous selection of tiles! Lovely lady helped me!

name: A C
text:
Try to keep your wits about you and understand that things can come with a catch. If you're a person looking to work for these guys, or if you saw a Craigslist ad, don't do it. It's just a pyramid scheme. You will not be paid.

You are going to be shown a demonstration of a Kirby vaccuum and how cool it is. While it is a cool product, these guys are going to tell you all sorts of promises about the job but the main things being the 2000/mo base pay and the fact that appointments are pre-arranged. What I am going to tell you should be enough to deter you alone:

You will not be going to pre-arranged appointments, you will be traveling in a old van up in Tennessee in the middle of nowhere in places like Union City (Don't know where that is? You're already on Google, so look it up on Google Maps) doing cold appointments as if this were the 50s. The vans are filled with your selfish 'team lead', a woman to knock on the doors, two 'Kirby sales veterans', and a few other people who fell for this like you did. No-trespassing signs? They don't care. Threatened to be shot? They don't care. Guard dogs? They don't care dude!

They are going to smoke, curse, and otherwise act unprofessional. You are going to slog through cold Fall and winter nights and days with no cell phone signal and 11 hour work periods with one or two lunch periods that you have to pay for out of your own pocket. You will enter the homes of old men and women or young couples who can't pay for it anyways. You will not get bathroom breaks because the team lead wont let you out unless you yell. Did I already mention you will be in the middle of nowhere too? Good, because this is important to note. Think about what I just said earlier in conjunction with this. If you're in the middle of the sticks with no cell phone signal with your only support being a bunch of jerks and two scared people also in your position with no power, what do you think will happen if you tick off  the driver? That's right, you will be kicked out of the van in the middle of redneck central with a dying cellphone batter and (if you were unlucky enough to fall for this in late fall to winter) frigid weather. Don't bother calling your 'employers' if this happens either, they will not care and will act as if you are bothering them. btw you'll be left in this position for hours at a time anyway if the person doesn't let you remain in their house after the appointment is over.

The feeling of hopelessness you will find surging through you will make you want to end it as you realize you will have to do this for six-days a week for a month.

I quit after three days of this, but you may sit through it to realize that you won't be paid a cent, because the 2000 base pay is not real!! You must satisfy $2000 worth of sales and THEN your sales will start to count towards your pay. Good luck doing that when you will maybe get one appointment a day tops since the 'team leads' let the more experienced members go first.

DO. NOT. DO. THIS.

I do not care if you are about to be homeless. Better to enter into that with honor than shame.

Oh yeah and as a post-statement: they mark up the price on the Kirby vacuum by 40%. So it's a scam 110% for their s̶u̶c̶k̶e̶r̶s̶ customers and 'employees'

name: Samar Misra
text:
I recall having a job interview with them in 2015 and I could detect the worst red flags off bat just from the interview.  First, in the interview I was not asked a thing about my skills or selling and just asked if I have no crimes on my record.  Second, when I myself asked what are the challenges of the position, the gentleman with a beard interviewing me said that there is high turnover due to nobody wanting to do the work.
Training is not paid for as unacceptable and wrong.

name: Jessi Malone
text:
This company does not pay you. They make everything seem great and they lie about every single thing.
They told me they weren't door to door, and I walked door to door the whole day. They also said they weren't gone too late in the evening and you didn't travel far, but on my first day I went in at 9:30, didn't get back until 8 o'clock at night, and we were in Franklin, Tennessee all day which is an hour and a half away from the office. DO NOT WORK NOR PURCHASE FROM THIS FRANCHISE!

name: Doug Schroeder
text: They sold us a Kirby and assured us that if we wanted to back out it was no problem. We changed our mind and called them that next day. They said the owner wasn't there and he was only one who can refund. We have called many times and even went there in person and still haven't gotten our money back. The owner is never in according to them. BUYER BEWARE DO NOT DO BUSINESS WITH THESE PEOPLE.

name: Margaret H
text:
Cancelled contract the correct way within 3 days of it.  Sudden medical expenses prevented purchase. Certified mail.  It was returned to me undeliverable.  Hand walked it down to this location, after talking photo of delivery attempts and hand delivered it to the salesman (husband of a former friend) who had removed the unit from my possession and recorded me telling him I wanted my $500 deposit back.  Been 3 weeks.  My $ has not been mailed to me.  I have no Kirby....they have my $500.  Next stop small claims.  Wish I had read reviews instead of going with a friendship that is now ruined.  Big mistake. So sad when business owners refuse to conduct business the right way.  I would have purchased after surgery bills are done in a month or so, but to hold onto $ when there's no product in my home I will never be a Kirby owner .What happens when money trumps friendship....buyer be ware.

It has now been 3 weeks since posting.  No check in my mailbox returning my $500 for a vac that's not in my home or possession.  Submitting small claims paperwork today.  Glad I photographed, recorded and copied EVERYTHING.  Do not let these people in your home.

name: Jon Hamlett
text: Salseman forced the product down my wifes throat...i agreed to buy it later but i do believe i was given a used demo model. Haven't had this kirby avalir 2 a year yet and the thing is smoking and locked up....garbage products and pushy salesmen. Oh and any number you try and call is disconnected or has been changed....total scammers and a 1 star is too good for these snakes.

name: Hidden Potions
text:
DEAR KIRBY COMPANY (JON SOLOMON)

SO I ASK YOU SIR ARE YOU THE SOURCE OF THE WAY THESE SALESMAN ARE TRAINED TO SYNC TO ANY LEVEL LOW TO SELL YOUR PRODUCT BY PRAYING ON ELDERLY PEOPLE OR ANYONE YOU COME IN CONTACT WITH AND THIS IS NOT AN OPINION THIS IS A FACT BEING I HAVE WORKED IN A COMPANY SELLING YOUR PRODUCT AS WELL AS WENT TO A DEMO AND SAW THE DECEIT WITH MY OWN TWO EYES AND QUIT THE SAME DAY I STARTED WHEN I SEEN HOW YOUR SALESMAN DO BUSINESS. name: Jessica Cagle
text:
After being assured that I'd get my check back if I changed my mind on the Kirby... I called the next day to cancel. When they picked up the vacuum I was told that my check would be mailed back to me. Two days later it was cashed (even though it was post dated). Haven't been able to get ahold of them since. They're liars and thieves. They serious financially hurt me (a single mother) and have no remorse for it at all. DO NOT BUY FROM THEM!!! Go to ebay or amazon and get a kirby.

UPDATE: After filling a complaint on BBB I got a call from the lady who proceeded to cuss me out saying I was in the wrong for signing a contract and then changing my mind. She said she'd repay me but it would be on the LAST day possible and not anytime sooner because I'm a  b!+@h for posting a bad review.
I don't understand how a company like this is even allowed to stay open!
Disrespectful, liars, and overall horrible human being who enjoys scamming people and then avoiding calls.

Thanks guys for your support

resp.text: Thank you, Gene! We hope to continue earning your business!

name: Donald Ferguson
text: My Atlas jack plate relay prematurely failed on my Ranger Bahia 240. It would go up, not down. I contacted customer service, gave then a little info and they immediately sent a new relay with the wiring harness attached. I just installed it myself, 20 minutes, and it works as new. Thank you for your help.

resp.text: Thank you for being a T-H Marine customer! If there is any other way we can help, please just let us know!

name: James Johnston
text: Seems like they wanted to make more money they would spend $8 an hour on somebody to answer their phonesIs impossible to get in touch with them

resp.text:
Hi James. Sorry to read that you had some difficulty reaching us by phone. :( Although we are not always able to predict just how many phone representatives we should have available, we are increasing our capacity to answer questions via social media (@thmarineteam) and our Help Page with email contact form (linked below), so please feel free to contact us anytime using those channels. If you can't reach us by phone, please visit us at www.thmarine.com/help -- from there, you can access a variety of FAQs, tips, and a contact form where we can get you directly connected with the right member of our team.

Either way, we'll do our best to provide you a personalized, typed reply, but you can also provide a call-back number and a good time to reach you if a phone call would be better. Sorry again for the trouble in getting through amid the other calls, but we hope you'll take advantage of one of our other options to get started with helping you.

name: Ersi Bice
text:
You guys have made if very difficult to earn my business in the future.  I ordered a tube where i can fit my electrical fish rod tools but to my surprise, the product arrives with no end caps.  All while the product picture has end caps, which is basically false advertisement.  So let me get this straight, your customers are coming to your site to buy an empty tube with no end caps?  I can conveniently drive to home depot and get a random pipe for that.  Or even ask my neighbor.  How about putting it in capital letters on your site  that "the tube doesn't come with end caps."  Then it would be up to the customer to read and do the proper product research.

But wait there's more.  So i was already super irritated at the lack of logic being used on this one but i refrained from writing a bad review.  Instead, I brushed it off, went on the website, and found I can just order these vynil end caps for $2, plus shipping.  Whatever! Right?  It happens!

But my disappointment didn't stop there.  I received the package, opened it and only one cap was inside.  Again, the product page is titled "black vynil caps" and the first picture is a picture of multiple caps.  So once again, misleading a returning customer that already gave you a second chance.  Where is the logic?  I am certain that you have run into this problem before.  Why is it not fixed.  You risk reputational damage for a few extra bucks.

I just don't understand how your number one priority isn't to make life easier for your customers and delighting them at every step of the sales process....  I am stuck between throwing the tube out and looking elsewhere, or just ordering another stupid end cap and paying shipping FOR THE THIRD TIME

resp.text: Hi Ersi. We are very sorry to read about this, but we do want to help you and improve what we're doing, too. Can you please send us this message at thmarine.com/writeus or contact us via Facebook Messenger? That will help us to get a better understanding of what we could do better, along with allowing us to ask some questions about this situation. Sorry again for the trouble, but we hope you'll write us so we can do our best to help.

name: David Waikem
text: I had an issue with a KVD Hydrowave unit, contacted TH Marine and all they asked for was a copy of the receipt. When they received the copy they sent a brand new unit out to me. All done within 10 days, excellent service and now a long term customer for sure!

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback! We hope to continue earning your business!

name: Parker Mott
text: T-H Marine is a one-stop shop marine for all you needs. My favorite product is the Loc-R-Bar... I travel across the country fishing pro tournaments, and their safety devices are the best out there. I never have to worry. I also love the T-H Marine LED trailer lights... they are more affordable than other LED lights and just as good, if not better in a lot of ways. Much easier to install for sure!! Thanks guys! Your customer service is amazing!!!!

resp.text: Thank you, Parker! We hope to see some pictures of your lights on social media — we love seeing those products in action, doing what they are supposed to.

name: Stephen Richter
text: T-H Marine is a great company with a product selection that keeps growing and growing. Whether you are looking for the (1) niche product or looking to fully customize your boat, they have you covered! To top things off, T-H Marine has great staff and service. The very few times I have needed to speak with them for questions I had, they were 100% in my book!

resp.text: Thank you, Stephen! We are thankful for your business. Tight lines!

name: Jacob A.
text: Good luck trying to reach them on the phone. Day three now and still haven't been able to speak with anyone.

resp.text: Sorry to read of this experience, Jacob, but we do want to help! We do not staff our phone lines over the weekend and we sometimes experience high-volume call times midday during the week, but you can reach us anytime on our website at www.thmarine.com/help -- from there, you can access a variety of FAQs, tips, and a contact form where we can get you directly connected with the right member of our team. You can also contact us via Facebook Messenger to leave us a message. Either way, we'll do our best to provide you a personalized, typed reply, but you can also provide a call-back number and a good time to reach you if a phone call would be better. Sorry again for the trouble in getting through amid the other calls, but we hope you'll take advantage of one of our other options to get started with helping you.

name: Frank Elasavage
text: I've been purchasing from TH Marine now for about a couple years and love their products! I've purchased everything from bow to stern on my bass boat and can tell you first hand,  their products are top notch!! I have everything from the HydroWave, G Force Elminator, Blue Water LED's lighting to an Atlas Jackplate! Their customer service is off the charts when it comes to help as well. If you haven't purchased from TH Marine, I would get give a try! Thet have you covered from bow to stern on all you boating needs.

resp.text: Thank you, Frank, for your continued business!

name: Jamin Gadoury
text: Getting through to this company is a miserable experiece. Getting them to send me a jack plate was an equally miserable experience! Their lack of customer service cost me 4+ weeks on the water! After finding out on the last go around that they hadn't sent the plate a week before hand. I will say they were nice enough to offer for me to pay an additional $300.00 to get my plate over nighted! I am in total disbelief that a company can treat their customers like this! I am praying that their product is more reliable than their service! I am very disappointed in the experience I have had with them. The only reason I gave 2 stars is because the jack plate looks very impressive and I am happy with the product! I pray it never has an issue that I have to contact customer service for!!!!!

name: Bug Tarleton
text: I had a life threatening experience yesterday with a "hot foot" that had no stop bolt on it.The throttle broke and the motor was wide-open throttle (W.O.T.) at 75 mph and I had to shut it off with the kill switch.I called the company to let them know that the stop was missing and that is what hyper-extended the other manufacturer part. I first told them that I wasn't going to sue them I just wanted them to know to fix the bolt so it couldn't be removed just adjusted.They never would let me explain what actually happened. They just kept saying they didn't make that part. It is SAD that someone will have to get killed to resolve this. I was just trying to save a family some grief. I called my dealer and my new part was on the way in ten minutes.That is how you do it, T AND H MARINE.Your products are great but your success has blinded you.

name: James W
text: I sell and install marine electronics and trolling motors.  I have never been able to get anyone to call me back with technical info on a product. I have talked to them numerous times at dealer shows and outdoor shows. They are very friendly and seem to know their products very well. Getting them to return a phone call is impossible for either me or my customers.

resp.text: We are very sorry to read you have had this kind of experience, James. If you would be so inclined, we would appreciate the chance to talk with you about how we can improve. Please write us at thminfo@thmarine.com and direct the message to Derek. Whether we need to improve our support line somehow, provide more resources online, or something else, we aim to do all that we can. Thank you for letting us know about this and thank you for working with T-H Marine products.

name: Bill Moody
text: Had never been there and was pleasantly surprised at the level of customer service, greeted by several people and was given instant attention by a James Taylor. Very knowledgeable about the questions I had for him and knew the product I was asking about. If you need help with a project, go there I think any of the gentleman behind the counter will be more than happy to help

resp.text: Dear Bill, thank you for taking the time to leave us this outstanding review. We will be sure to pass along the kind words to our Auburn team. We appreciate your business!

name: Walter East
text: Always good service.

resp.text: Dear Walter, thank you for taking the time to leave us this excellent review. We are pleased to hear that our service is matching your expectations. We appreciate your business!

name: Jeremy Davis
text: Good heating and air conditioning parts.  Great  employees there

name: Carolyn Way
text: If i could have clicked Zero stars to rate my experience in this store I would have. The man behind the register was the rudest person i've ever encountered. I asked him a question and he rudely responded and when I told him i'd not be back in his store he stated that was fine. I don't know if he was the manager or an employee but there was no excuse for his rudeness. If they treat all their customers the way i was treated they won't be in business at that office long.

name: Marty Brady
text: So this morning we were getting ready to check out of a campground near Cartersville Ga.  We had multiple issues and called Blackhawk.  They were great to deal with over the phone, helped walk me through solutions and tonight we are in Ohio at campground heading on to Michigan home in the morning. Thanks so much for your help and I would highly recommend these guys to anyone.

name: Nathina Greco
text: I see all the reviews are over 2 years ago, please allow me to update you with a current review. I WILL SUPPLY PHOTOS AND AUDIO OF OUR CONVERSATIONS( from when I picked it up) TO PROVE EVERYTHING STATED HERE IS TRUE! I found Trey(the owner) via Facebook, I always do my research. I saw these reviews, and decided to give him a call, it was a week before memorial day weekend. I can provide all call logs, I told him I have an RV that has a lighting issue that I need checked. Considering I am a first time owner he said it may be a simple fix. I said great when may I drop it by? He said he is backed up and it would really help him out a lot if I could bring it by that Tuesday, I told him that sounds great. He asked that I send him my address and the issues via text before hand. I did. I had to work late and had my cousin drop it off. Please see the photos of our texts. I told him a million times DO NOT BUY ANYTHING for the RV I ONLY want a diagnosis. He took a week, and ended up purchasing: -LP for the RV, Checking the outside, HE BROKE the generator and told me that it stopped working. He even said on audio, it was working when you dropped it off. HE broke the battery disconnect again which was working when I dropped it off. When I went to pick it up he kept repeating how he put me in front of other projects and he needs more time. I explained how he told  me to bring it in on that day because he was behind the previous week. He said well ,.... this that...ect Please see the itemized bill of the charges and work he tried to charge me for that I specifically asked him not to do. I have no doubt he is good at working on more commercial projects,but to try and take advantage of  smaller projects is just not good business. I found another company I would recommend to anyone else who is looking for help, If you drive to him he will diagnose for free and walk the entire vehicle with you! It's Deitz Mobile RV. He does have a few different businesses so his response may be slow, but at least he is honest and up front about everything!

name: Charles Michael
text: Trey (owner)  was  100% accurate on his diagnosis  and repair of my 2002 Road Trek 190 P RV. His prices were more than fair and he stands  behind  his word...100%  !  I found a RV repair shop that I"ll be staying with a long time.

resp.text: Thank You Charles!

name: Corey Ford
text: Trey , the owner of the company does superior service and provides the very best in care for your boat or Rv, highly recommend his company.

resp.text: Thank you Corey Ford

name: Phillip Mccall
text: Fantastic experience w my rv repair. Thanks trey

name: Oli-D TV
text: Your not another face in the crowd with Trey/Blackhawk his customer service is top notch and you can tell he really cares about his customers and your boat (or camper). My new go to guy.

name: irv klayman
text: Fast turn around service 2 days very reasonable price rate highly recommend

resp.text: Thank u Irv Klayman

name: Jeff Conley
text: If you have a need for drywall, this IS the place to go !!! I'm thankful they are moving to Tuscumbia, closer to me

resp.text: Jeff, Thank you for the great review. We truly appreciate your business.

name: Daniel Craig
text: Best products. Best prices and a product knowledgeable staff. Keep up the good work.

name: aNotha DunnDeal
text: As a trucker, the delivery docks have very little room to maneuver. Its alot of empty pallets and a large dumpster in the way. Be ready to take your time and don't expect anybody to spot you. However the dock workers did unload rather quickly..in and out

name: Christy Awad
text: Working here sucked really bad. I mean it's a good business I guess but the hours and shifts are very long and there is no opportunity for growth in the company.  They basically treat you like you're beneath them in a way. And it is a point system. You fire your own self. You get ten points and you lose your job. And half a point if you miss less than 4 hours in a shift. They are very strict and it's tough getting up at 4:30 in the morning and going to deal with stuck up people and long long days!!! Glad that's over!!!

name: Jessica Burgess
text: I put n 2 applications in there they did call the 2sy time for a interview Nd I couldn’t make it at that point bc of transportation proothat was 6 months ago well put another in no call or nothing went up there Nd still nothing so I went to a temp service they told me they would call yesterday or today well they did yesterday for a job bunt went to another temp service Nd went to another place Nd it’s such easy work no drama or rudeness the supervisors t very respectful to u very easy Nd laid back work there only bad thing is standing 20 hours except ur 2 10 min breaks Nd lunch I’m so very glad I didn’t choose CR Gibson Nd went with the other place pay could b better but I’ll take it all day to not have to deal with rudeness or drama all day day yes long hours Nd 6 days eight now but I’ll take 16 hours overtime any day can always use the extra money all day everyday,...,,,

name: Cody Garrison
text: Not the best place to work alot of greenhats

name: Mavis Brandenburg
text: Took my daughter for a job.She needed that job.They didnt even have decency to call her back or anything.She would call them.They wouldnt tell her anything.Poor managment!

name: Denise Wood
text: Not bad to work at. Needs air in the warehouse.

name: Judy Williams
text: Yes nice place very big parking lot

name: Amanda Arndt
text: Long hours with 3 short breaks. They scream at you and talk to you like trash. Nope!

name: Andrew Armstead
text: ! I work there for 5 daysand in those 5 daysthey did train very well they could notreally give me a reason on why they let me go

name: Shaleigh Miller
text: My husband worked here for a few weeks after that they sent him home sick & told him they would call him back. After a week solid of calling & going up there with no answer as to when he could return to work he finally gave up & got another job this is no way to treat your employees.

name: A some body
text: Company changes a lot and they have little pay $8.67 hour for everyone much drama staff are often hateful.

name: Jeff Baker
text: Good place to work

name: Renee Box

name: Stephanie Gray White

name: Rosanna Adams
text: Good place to work

name: Noeun Kim
text: The place is gated. Very nice warehouse and clean! Loaded in 1hr. Check in by employee parking "main entrance " . Clean bathroom!

name: Ciccio Lino
text: Super fast loading,in & out in less than 30 minutes,nice and spacious facility..The only downside is the driver's check in with the phone at the gate,which is not functional..Instead of calling,pull in and go in the middle of the warehouse to the main office, where the shipping/receiving office is also located

name: Gunnar Bartels
text: New and clean facility, and absolutely professional. Trailer was loaded in 8 (!) minutes, it took me longer to overcome my disbelief that they are done already.

name: Karima H
text: Truck entrance is on beehive road drive up to the gate and press the button you will be buzzed in go to the main entrance to check in. They was pretty fast loading only took an hour.

name: Manuel Mendoza
text: people in shipping department are very fast and professionals

name: Big R 504
text: In and out👍

name: Jose Luis Lopez
text:
(Translated by Google) Very good place they loaded me up really fast

(Original)
Muy buen lugar me cargaron bien rápido

name: Daniel White
text: Took about an hour 1.5 hours to unload me

name: Alicia Pinkney
text: Great place to work.

name: Matthew Veltman
text: I work here. The staff and my co-workers are very good family based individuals.

name: Ronny Alewine

name: Alex Higgins
text: One of the better places to work

name: Melissa Jackson
text: I worked there.

name: Reggie Burke
text: Great unload

name: Roy Ferrante
text: Inventory Management, Supply Chain Solutions, Inspection and Testing. One stop shop. Great company to work with.

name: eleazar “eli” cisneros
text: Taking a loss for USA

name: Ronny Alewine
text: Get unloaded pretty quickly!

name: Upinder Sodhi
text: Quick loading after little bit wait

name: Keith Russell
text: Delivered a load of freight to these folks.  They were very helpful, prompt and cordial.  Wish more customers were as nice to truck drivers as these folks were.

name: Merk Austin
text: Its a good place 2 work wit good hours. But the pay sucks when ur a temp

name: Ronald Travis
text: Small furniture distribution warehouse. They load pretty quick. The staff is very friendly.

name: Jimmy Love
text: Owner Ops/Drivers be aware. You will be at this place a long time for loading. I arrived at 11:45 am and it 4:05 pm as I’m writing this review and I’m still not loaded. That’s not the worst part. There’s a driver that’s been here since 8:00 am and he’s still waiting for them to START loading him. The loaders are standing around talking and on their phones without a care in the world. Sitting on the freight when they should be loading it. It seems like they take a cigarette break every 30min for 30min. It’s a shame. It’s a waist of time here. Give the load back and find something else to haul.

name: Fellowdante
text: Surprised to see that they move fast for a furniture place, about 1hr to get loaded!!!!

name: Night Train
text: Easy to get to, lots of room, you can take your break there.   Drop b hook, but they have till appt time to load it.  You can pick up Atwater hours.  Bills in the mailbox.

name: Robert Martin
text: This place is hard to figure out, sometimes with a 7am appt, I'll be loaded in 2 hours, then their are days I can have a 7am appt an be stuck there for 7 hours to load a partial load, the lady in the office is friendly.

name: Serega Czerniak
text:
They deserve zero stars, because it’s crazy!
Check in 7:15am
App 8:00 am
Got the door at 8:00am
Starting to load at 1:30 pm
Check out 6:00 pm
This is not joke! 10 hours to load!

name: Ivan Komar
text: I should’ve listened to these reviews. 6 hours loading, mixed up multiple stop load. Had issues with deliveries when some stops where missing boxes of furniture, and final stop had extras. These staff was left in a truck and then I wasted time and money to get rid of these boxes and finally be free from that load. What should only take 2 days to deliver, took 5....lost revenue

name: Jun Tong (Jun's pool services)
text: must have pickup number start with 101…… they have restroom for drivers ， 3hours loading time

name: Denisha Rene' Burney
text: Out

name: Jason Allen
text: Wouldn’t use their product if it was given to me. Saw videos of what goes on here. Night shift makes up test results, just trashy people smoking all over, and terrible people on safety. Ordered 2 loads and it was all garbage. And now I know why!

text: Love this place. Highly recommend everyone to go there. Place looks piled up but the man that runs the place knows exactly where everything is.

name: Thomas Christensen
text: This your old school hardware store. If you need it, it's there somewhere. You might have to search a bit, and trip over a few things, but it's there.

name: Porkchopranch
text: Good folks. If you need it they probably have. If it is hard to find part they will have it or know were to get it.

text: This place has everything i need and very knowledgeable staff .

name: Donald Townson
text: This hardware store has everything you need

name: Glenn Priest
text: This is old school hardware store. Love it !

name: Rhonda Pascual
text: Great little small hardware store. Come here instead of the Rainsville Ace hardware. The gentleman who runs the store is very polite and helpful. The aisles are narrow,because so many items are in the store,,but they most likely have anything you need and will help you find it. They aren't overpriced.We got some plumbing tubing here,that even Lowe's didn't have. I highly recommend this small hometown store

name: Appalachian American
text: I been going here for years & they're very helpful.knowledgeable.if you can't find what you need here it probably doesn't exist. Very good people to do business with.really have helped me find what I needed in plumbing & other hardware.even gave me my refund back after I'd forgotten about it.very good people here & a very good local business.I recommend this place.

text: Great

name: Love trucking T
text: Truckers good news this is a very good place to be. First of all let me say this I'm not a 100%sure if this men was the owner of the business, but  a white elder guy  with then 2 minutes of my arrival he greeted me well even told me where the rest area is. Then I was told to back up in to  a dock right a way witch was very nice. I will definitely come back here.👍
